docs.title: Manipulate and visualize collections of time series data.
docs.text:
An open-source Python library for Data Scientists to efficiently manipulate collections of time series data. Features include data loading, transformation, persistence, and visualization.

  • Documentation: https://elehcimd.github.io/cumulative
  • Source code: https://github.com/elehcimd/cumulative (License: BSD 3-Clause)
  • Discussions: Ask questions, share ideas, engage
  • Funding: You can star the project on GitHub and hire me to make sense of your time series data

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To install Cumulative:

pip install cumulative --upgrade

How to integrate Cumulative it in your projects?

Cumulative is progressing rapidly and interfaces might change at any time. Pin its exact version for your project, to make sure it all works. Have tests for your project, and update it once you verify that things work correctly.

docs.title: License
docs.text:
This project is licensed under the terms of the BSD 3-Clause License.

Latest update: 2024-06-06 using mltraq==0.0.30

docs.title: Citing Cumulative in your publications
docs.text:
You are welcome to cite Cumulative in your research:

@software{cumulative2024,
  author = {Michele Dallachiesa},
  license = {BSD-3},
  title = {Cumulative: Manipulate and visualize collections of time series data.},
  url = {https://github.com/elehcimd/cumulative},
  year = {2024}
}

docs.title: Become a sponsor
docs.text: By joining the Insiders program, you'll get immediate access to the latest features while also helping support the ongoing development of Cumulative. Thanks to our awesome sponsors, this project is actively maintained.

docs.title: How to join the Insiders program
docs.text: Please send a short email with "SPONSOR-CUMULATIVE" in the subject to michele.dallachiesa@sigforge.com and I will get back to you.

docs.title: Other ways to support the initiative
docs.text: You can star the project on GitHub and hire me to make sense of your time series data.
